summary: Initialize a Temporal Attention Encoder (TAE) model
description: Creates and configures a Temporal Attention Encoder (TAE) model. TAE leverages temporal attention mechanisms to process and analyze sequential data effectively. Parameters such as optimizer, learning rate, and decay schedules can be customized.

parameters.name: epochs
parameters.description: The number of training epochs. Defaults to 150.

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.description: The size of batches for training. Defaults to 64.

parameters.name: optimizer
parameters.description: The optimizer to use for training. Defaults to 'adam'. Supported values include 'adam', 'adabound', 'adabelief', 'madagrad', 'nadam', 'qhadam', 'radam', 'swats', and 'yogi'.

parameters.name: learning_rate
parameters.description: The initial learning rate for training. Defaults to 0.001.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.description: The epsilon value for numerical stability in optimizers. Defaults to 1e-8.

parameters.name: weight_decay
parameters.description: The weight decay (L2 penalty) value for regularization. Defaults to 0.000001.

parameters.name: lr_decay_epochs
parameters.description: The number of epochs after which the learning rate is decayed. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: lr_decay_rate
parameters.description: The rate at which the learning rate is decayed after the specified number of epochs. Defaults to 0.95.

returns.description: An untrained Temporal Attention Encoder (TAE) model instance.

links.description: Research paper describing the Temporal Attention Encoder (TAE) and its application in satellite image time series classification.
links.citation: V. Garnot, L. Landrieu, S. Giordano, and N. Chehata, “Satellite Image Time Series Classification With Pixel-Set Encoders and Temporal Self-Attention,” in 2020 IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), 2020, pp. 12322–12331, doi: 10.1109/CVPR42600.2020.01234.
